Description: Amid ongoing feud with the party controlling the parliament, Senegal's President Bassirou Diomaye Faye has said he would dissolve the parliament in coming days

Title: Did Iran sell ballistic missiles to Russia? Kremlin doesn't deny
Description: Iran is our important partner, we are developing our trade and economic relations, we are developing our cooperation and dialogue in all possible areas', says Kremlin spokesman, Dmitry Peskov,

Title: ‘I never got to meet you’: 9/11 anniversary tradition sees a generational change at ground zero
Description: Each year at the 9/11 Memorial, young relatives of victims read the names of those lost, reflecting a generational shift as many were born after the attacks. Their participation underscores a deep, ongoing connection to the events of September 11, 2001, and the importance of preserving their stories and legacies

Title: Iraq says US will withdraw troops from Baghdad, other areas from next year
Description: The United States has some 2,500 troops in Iraq and 900 in Syria as part of the international coalition against the Islamic State group

Title: Is US govt responsible for cancer, widespread illness among Nevada tribal community?
Description: The community of the Duck Valley Indian Reservation faces rising health concerns as evidence suggests potential contamination from Agent Orange and other toxins linked to a U.S. maintenance building. Tribal leaders, grappling with a high cancer rate and ongoing environmental issues, are pushing for an urgent federal investigation into the contamination's impact on their land and health

Title: With $4.2 bn ‘digital wallet’ handout, Thailand hopes to jumpstart SE Asia’s second major economy
Description: The measure, which was scheduled for rollout in the last quarter of this year, is the cornerstone of Thailand's plans to jumpstart Southeast Asia's second-largest economy, which grew 2.3% in the second quarter

Title: Before Harris duels with Trump, a look at how US veep has handled debates in the past
Description: In her debates through the years, Kamala Harris has tried to blend punch lines with details that build toward a broader narrative

Title: Fresh Israeli strike in Syria leaves 14 dead, over 40 injured
Description: Israeli airstrikes in Syria overnight have resulted in 14 deaths and over 40 injuries, according to Syrian state media. The strikes, which targeted areas including a scientific research center and sites associated with Iranian militias, have caused extensive damage and sparked fires

Title: Indonesia plane with 48 on board skids off runway, several injured
Description: The ATR-42 aircraft belonging to Trigana Air was taking off from an airport in the remote Yapen Islands regency to Papuan capital Jayapura on Monday morning when it skidded off the runway

Title: Venezuela: Gonzalez exiled, Machado hiding; how Maduro sealed ‘victory’ after disputed polls

Title: 35 dead, 24 missing as typhoon Yagi batters Vietnam and its infrastructure
Description: Typhoon Yagi, the strongest storm in Asia this year, has caused significant damage in northern Vietnam, leaving at least 35 people dead and 24 missing due to floods and landslides. The storm, which made landfall on Saturday, led to widespread power outages, infrastructure destruction, and economic disruption, with continued warnings of further floods and landslides

Title: Turkey’s Erdogan furious with military graduates who took ‘pro-secular’ oath, vows to ‘purge’ them
Description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has vowed to purge military graduates who took a pro-secular oath during their graduation ceremony, calling them 'opportunists' and promising a thorough investigation

Title: China ventures into medical tourism with a luxe twist while India leads in affordability

Title: WATCH: PM Modi hugs Abu Dhabi Crown Prince on his first India visit, what's on his 2-day schedule
Description: On the first day of his two-day India visit, the Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi, Sheikh Khaled bin Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, is expected to hold discussions with PM Modi on a wide range of areas of bilateral cooperation

Title: Civil trial begins today over Trump Train incident of 2020 in Texas

Title: Russian military unit behind Nato, EU cyber attacks: Germany intelligence

This alert, issued in coordination with international partners, highlights ongoing concerns over Russian cyber activities and espionage amid heightened tensions in Europe

Title: German Tibet activist denied entry into Hong Kong after hours of interrogation
Description: David Missal, a German Tibet rights activist, was denied entry into Hong Kong after enduring hours of questioning by immigration officials. This incident highlights ongoing travel restrictions and heightened scrutiny faced by activists and international representatives in the region

Title: Death toll rises to 24 as Typhoon Yagi triggers widespread landslides and flooding in Vietnam
Description: The typhoon was Asia's most powerful storm this year and made landfall on the country's northeastern coast on Saturday

Title: Seoul conference seeks blueprint for responsible AI use in the military
Description: The Seoul summit hoped to agree to a blueprint for action, establishing a minimum level of guard-rails for AI in the military and suggesting principles on responsible use by reflecting principles laid out by NATO, by the U.S. or a number of other countries, according to a senior South Korean official

Title: 6 things about first India-GCC foreign ministers' meet in Riyadh
Description: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar attends the first India-GCC Foreign Ministers' Meeting in Riyadh, aiming to strengthen ties in trade, investment, and energy. This article lists key highlights and diplomatic moves from this historic event

Title: Spanish PM in China second time in 18 months, eyes on trade ties amid EV tariff spat

Title: Algeria's Abdelmadjid Tebboune wins second presidential term with 95% vote
Description: Tebboune, 78, was heavily favoured to secure a five-year second term in the race against moderate Islamist Abdelaali Hassani, 57, who took 3.17 percent of the vote, and socialist candidate Youcef Aouchiche, 41, who won 2.16 percent

Title: Tragedy strikes as fuel tanker crash kills 48, burns 50 cattle in Nigeria
Description: With the absence of an efficient railway system to transport cargo, fatal truck accidents are common along most of the major roads in Nigeria, Africa’s most populous country

Title: China tells Philippines to rethink relations amid South China Sea tensions
Description: The Philippines and China have exchanged accusations of intentionally ramming coast guard vessels in the disputed waterway in recent months, including a violent clash in June in which a Filipino sailor lost a finger

Title: Another fire breaks out at a Kenyan school, third incident in just days
Description: A dorm at Njia Boys High School in the central county of Meru caught fire as students were having supper and no casualties were reported, a police statement said.

Title: 3 Israelis shot dead at West Bank-Jordan border, Netanyahu calls gunman 'abhorrent terrorist'
Description: The incident took place on Sunday at the Allenby Bridge crossing over the River Jordan. The bridge is also known as the King Hussein Bridge

Title: Israel conducts strikes in central Syria killing 7 people, injuring 15 others: Report
Description: It is pertinent to note that the Masyaf area has been repeatedly targeted in recent years and most of the attacks in the region have been widely attributed to Israel. The Syrian region is home to the Scientific Studies and Research Center, known as CERS or SSRC

Title: Thousands protest against Mexican judicial reform which proposes judges elected by popular vote
Description: They gathered in Mexico City as the Senate began to debate the initiative pushed by outgoing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador and approved by the lower house, called the Chamber of Deputies, in which the ruling party holds sway

Title: Russia advances in eastern Ukraine, drones breach NATO airspace
Description: Moscow has stepped up its aerial attacks in recent weeks, but it is also trying to fight off a major Ukrainian cross-border offensive into its western Kursk region, which has reshaped the course of the two-and-a-half-year war.

Title: Algeria re-elects President Abdelmadjid Tebboune with 94.7 percent vote
Description: Election officials reported less than six million of the country's 24 million voters had turned out to vote on Saturday, perpetuating the low voter turnout rates that marred Tebboune's first term and raised questions about his popular support.

Title: Georgia shooting: Mother of suspect called school before attack, warned about 'extreme emergency'
Description: Phone records provided by a relative to the Post show a 10-minute call to Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia, at 9:50 a.m., about 30 minutes before the attack began.

Title: Pakistan: Imran Khan's party stage rally; demand his immediate release
Description: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf slammed the government for its crackdown on the party as police fired tear gas to disperse the crowd.

Description: Three Israelis were shot and killed Sunday at the border crossing between the West Bank and Jordan, Israeli officials said, in what appeared to be an attack linked to the 11-month-old war in Gaza.

Title: Bangladesh wants relations with India based on equity & fairness: Chief Adviser Yunus
Description: Yunus, 84, made the remarks while responding to a question at a meeting with students who had participated in the student-people revolution that ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina last month, state-run BSS news agency reported.

Title: Harris vs Trump: Philadelphia debate to spotlight Pennsylvania's influence in 2024 presidential race
Description: Pennsylvanians broke a string of six Democratic victories in the state when they helped propel Trump to victory in 2016, then backed native son Joe Biden in the 2020 race against Trump.

Title: Boeing inks deal to avoid strike, offers 25% pay raise, $3,000 bonuses & more
Description: An accepted deal would secure labor peace for Boeing at a time when the planemaker is burning cash and trying to raise production of its strongest-selling 737 MAX to a target rate of 38 aircraft a month by the year's end. It also avoids a strike that could have made Boeing a focus point in the 2024 presidential election.

Title: In final campaign push, Kamala Harris uses favorite food, childhood memories to connect with voters
Description: From talking about nacho cheese Doritos as her snack of choice to washing collard greens in the bathtub, Harris is aiming to connect with voters on a more personal level.

Title: Sudan rejects UN experts' call for 'impartial' force as death toll reaches over 20,000
Description: The conflict since April last year, pitting the army against paramilitary forces, has killed tens of thousands of people and triggered one of the world's worst humanitarian crises.

Title: Greece to impose a 20-euro tax on cruise ship arrivals to protect popular islands from overtourism
Description: Greece relies heavily on tourism, the main driver of the country’s economy which is still recovering from a decade-long crisis that wiped out a fourth of its output.

Title: Algeria: Abdelmadjid Tebboune poised for victory amid allegations of 'inflated results'
Description: The campaign of Algerian presidential challenger Abdelaali Hassani claimed on Sunday there was vote-rigging during the previous day's election which incumbent Abdelmadjid Tebboune is expected to win.

Title: Stop sponsoring terror, we will start dialogue': India's stern message to Pakistan
Description: The defence minister said when Pakistan stops sponsoring terrorism in Jammu and Kashmir, India will start dialogue with them.

Title: Pakistan's economic woes deepen as it faces complex web of challenges
Description: Another commentator noted that Pakistan heavily relies on the generosity of external benefactors and seems unwilling to make the tough decisions necessary to revive its economy.

Title: Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Al Nahyan arrives in Delhi to boost bilateral ties
Description: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal received the Crown Prince at the airport following which he was accorded a ceremonial welcome, in reflection of the importance India has attached to the visit.

Title: US polls 2024: Georgia’s black voters at the center of Trump-Harris election showdown
Description: A significant contest is unfolding over the Black voters in a battleground state, where they constitute a third of the population—the highest proportion among the seven states that will determine the outcome of the November 5 presidential election. This demographic is expected to play a crucial role in shaping the election's result, making it a key focus for both parties.

Title: US Republicans push for citizenship check in government funding bill
Description: House Speaker Mike Johnson has proposed a six-month stop-gap funding bill that includes a controversial requirement for proof of citizenship for voter registration. The bill is expected to face strong opposition from Democrats and may complicate efforts to avoid a government shutdown

Title: India reports suspected mpox case in traveller from affected country
Description: Mpox can spread through close contact. Usually mild, it is fatal in rare cases. It causes flu-like symptoms and pus-filled lesions on the body.

Title: After one year, just 1,000 Morrocan homes rebuilt out of 60,000 destroyed in quake
Description: One year after the devastating 6.8-magnitude earthquake in Morocco's High Atlas region, only 1,000 of the 60,000 damaged homes have been rebuilt. Reconstruction efforts are hampered by slow permit approvals and administrative hurdles, leaving many victims still living in temporary shelters

Title: Libya detains militia leader in human trafficker's killing probe
Description: Libya's chief prosecutor has ordered the detention of Mohamed Bahroun, a prominent militia leader, and his aide as part of an investigation into the killing of notorious human trafficker Abdel-Rahman Milad. The detention follows allegations of their involvement in Milad's September 1st shooting in Tripoli
